solution_line_template: One trip to school is {round_trip_multiplier} * {distance_to_school} km = <<{round_trip_multiplier}*{distance_to_school}={distance_per_day}>>{distance_per_day}km.

In one week, Christina walks {distance_per_day} km/day * {school_days_per_week} days/week = <<{distance_per_day}*{school_days_per_week}={distance_to_school_per_week}>>{distance_to_school_per_week}km to school.

The extra trip to her mum's friend added {extra_distance_to_friend} km * {round_trip_multiplier_friend} = <<{extra_distance_to_friend}*{round_trip_multiplier_friend}={extra_distance_total}>>{extra_distance_total}km to her travel distance.
Her total distance was thus {distance_to_school_per_week} km + {extra_distance_total} km = <<{distance_to_school_per_week}+{extra_distance_total}={total_distance_week}>>{total_distance_week} km
